publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4145 Mr Frank McAveety: DEAFinitely Greener Gains Support of Climate Challenge Fund—That the Parliament congratulates Deaf Connections, which received £16,850 from the Climate Challenge Fund for its project, DEAFinately Greener; endorses plans to ensure that all deaf people across Scotland have equal access to information and advice about climate change in British Sign Language (BSL); highlights the opportunity to overcome communication barriers and empower deaf people to reduce their carbon footprints, and welcomes the continued efforts of the Climate Challenge Fund in encouraging people and communities to take steps to reduce carbon emissions.

S3M-4145 Mr Frank McAveety: DEAFinitely Greener Gains Support of Climate Challenge Fund—That the Parliament congratulates Deaf Connections, which received £16,850 from the Climate Challenge Fund for its project, DEAFinately Greener; endorses plans to ensure that all deaf people across Scotland have equal access to information and advice about climate change in British Sign Language (BSL); highlights the opportunity to overcome communication barriers and empower deaf people to reduce their carbon footprints, and welcomes the continued efforts of the Climate Challenge Fund in encouraging people and communities to take steps to reduce carbon emissions.

S3M-4145 DEAFinitely Greener Gains Support of Climate Challenge Fund (lodged on 14 May 2009) Mike Pringle*, Hugh Henry*, Elaine Murray*, Stuart McMillan*, Mary Mulligan*, Sarah Boyack*, Jackie Baillie*, Patricia Ferguson*, Cathie Craigie*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*, David Stewart*, Marilyn Livingstone*
